snippet: A bishop wrote to the office of Msgr. William J. Lynn, who is on trial in Philadelphia, that a church worker worried about a parish priest’s pornography was trying to “stir up conflict.”
abstract: Testimony in the trial of Monsignor William J Lynn of Philadelphia reveals that Bishop Robert P Maginnis told Lynn in 1996 that a church worker was trying to 'stir up conflict' after she reported her concern that a different priest in her parish was receiving pornography in the mail; Lynn is suspected of allowing priests accused of sexually abusing children to remain in positions where they could continue to prey on minors.
lead_paragraph: A bishop wrote to the office of Msgr. William J. Lynn, who is on trial in Philadelphia, that a church worker worried about a parish priest’s pornography was trying to “stir up conflict.”
